About

ShenzEd is a Professional Learning Network for the International School sector in Shenzhen, China. Members of the network come together to share exemplary practices in a collegial environment with the goal of collaboratively enriching pedagogical repertoires.

Professional Development

Have the opportunity to be exposed to new, creative ideas and reflect upon and review your teaching practice.

Collaboration

Meet with like-minded educators to discuss, explore, inquire into and gain exposure to new ideas and topics that are relevant to your teaching.

Networking

With so many international educators in the area, ShenzEd aims to connect educators from across the city.

Pedagogical Possibilities in ICT

In this session teachers will explore a variety of easy to use tech tools that will enhance pedagogical practices, and actively engage students in learning. Inspired and informed, participants will be motivated to implement fresh ideas for using Nearpod, Kahoot, Wizer Me, Plickers and Zaption in their own learning environments. Participants should bring a connected device.

  • Workshop Date: March 2, 2017

Doodling My Way Through the PYP

There are many advantages to including drawings in my lessons and note-taking with students. My interest in doodling in class began in response to my students' needs. One year I found myself teaching a Grade 5 class with several special needs students who were unable to read. In order to not leave these students further behind, I began visual note-taking with the class so that students could make meaning through connecting images and pictures to the information that they were absorbing through listening. I quickly realized that these note-taking lessons were also highly benefiting not only these special needs learners, but my EAL and visual inclined learners as well. In this workshop I will provide tips for easy doodle integration while note-taking and give suggestions for ways that students can use drawing to demonstrate their understanding of material.

  • Workshop Date: March 2, 2017

Coding Across the Subjects

Are you interested in bringing coding into your classroom but just not sure where to start?

This introductory coding workshop is focused on helping you to see opportunities for its integration across various subject areas. As a mathematics teacher, I will show several examples of how I have used coding within my own classroom. In addition, I will provide some examples of possible student programming tasks that align with science, languages and art.

The level of prior knowledge required with programming is beginner to intermediate while the curricular examples will be aimed at grades 6 to 12. The coding examples will mainly use the Python programming language, with some examples using Scratch. It is encouraged that participants bring their laptops if possible, as time permitting, we will end the session by coding a basic math program.

  • Workshop Date: March 2, 2017
